Actually, htmlunit and httpunit are quite different implementations.
The latest htmlunit does most JavaScript these days but quite possibly
not all. I have used it to test Ajax applications. Actually, via some
layers but using HtmlUnit underneath:

DSL -> Groovy -> WebTest -> HtmlUnit

Paul.

Simon Chappell wrote:
> On 8/21/07, hi@... <mailto:hi%40hi.com> <jobs4wil@... 
> <mailto:jobs4wil%40yahoo.com>> wrote:
> 
>  > Hi,
>  > Can you someone tell me if anyone has used htmlunit to
>  > test ajax web applications? If so, does htmlunit work
>  > with heavy javascript applications? And how does your
>  > organization like it/support it? Is it easy to
>  > maintain?
> 
> I've had no luck with testing JavaScript-heavy applications using
> HttpUnit (which HtmlUnit is based upon) so I'll be interested to hear
> if anyone has managed to get it to work.
> 
> Simon
subject: Re: [junit] htmlunit
